body:
If we have externally installed packages or compilers with `modules` and if we specify those modules in Spack config files (`packages.yaml`, `compilers.yaml`) then we should not require `--dirty` flag. At least this is expectation from Slack discussion. But this is not the case.

Here is an example:

We have gcc module as:

```
→ module show gcc_490
-------------------------------------------------------------------
/gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/home/kumbhar/my_modules/gcc_490:

module-whatis	 Loads gcc 4.9.0 to your environment variables
prepend-path	 PATH /gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch//apps/viz/tools/gcc/gcc-4.9.0/install/bin
prepend-path	 LD_LIBRARY_PATH /gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch//apps/viz/tools/gcc/gcc-4.9.0/install/lib64
prepend-path	 LD_LIBRARY_PATH /gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/apps/viz/tools/mpc/mpc-1.0.2/install/lib
prepend-path	 LD_LIBRARY_PATH /gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/apps/viz/tools/mpfr/mpfr-3.1.2/install/lib
prepend-path	 LD_LIBRARY_PATH /gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/apps/viz/tools/gmp/gmp-5.1.3/install/lib
prepend-path	 LD_RUN_PATH /gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch//apps/viz/tools/gcc/gcc-4.9.0/install/lib64
prepend-path	 CPATH /gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch//apps/viz/tools/gcc/gcc-4.9.0/install/include
prepend-path	 SEARCH_DIR /gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch//apps/viz/tools/gcc/gcc-4.9.0/install/lib64
```

We add entry to `compilers.yaml` as:

```
- compiler:
    flags: {}
    modules:
    - gcc_490
    operating_system: rhel6
    paths:
      cc: /gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/apps/viz/tools/gcc/gcc-4.9.0/install/bin/gcc
      cxx: /gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/apps/viz/tools/gcc/gcc-4.9.0/install/bin/g++
      f77: /gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/apps/viz/tools/gcc/gcc-4.9.0/install/bin/gfortran
      fc: /gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/apps/viz/tools/gcc/gcc-4.9.0/install/bin/gfortran
    spec: gcc@4.9.0
```

As we have specified module then it should work without dirty. Isn't it? But we get:

```
$ spack -d install -v everytrace %gcc@4.9.0
...
/gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/apps/viz/tools/gcc/gcc-4.9.0/install/bin/../libexec/gcc/x86_64-unknown-linux-
gnu/4.9.0/cc1: error while loading shared libraries: libmpc.so.3: cannot open shared object file: No 
.... 
"/gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/home/kumbhar/workarena/systems/lugviz/softwares/sources/spack/lib/
spack/env/gcc/gfortran"
  is not able to compile a simple test program.
....
```

If I look at `spack-build.env` with and without dirty then we see that `LD_LIBRARY_PATH` is set only with `--dirty`:

```
 → diff spack-build.env spack-build.env.dirty
84a85
> export CPATH="/gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch//apps/viz/tools/gcc/gcc-4.9.0/install/include:/gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/apps/viz/tools/gmp/gmp-5.1.3/install/include:/gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/apps/viz/tools/mpfr/mpfr-3.1.2/install/include:/gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/apps/viz/tools/mpc/mpc-1.0.2/install/include"
112a114,115
> export LD_LIBRARY_PATH="/gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/apps/viz/tools/mvapich2/mvapich2-2.0.1-nocuda-slurm-14.03.4.2/install/lib:/gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch//apps/viz/tools/gcc/gcc-4.9.0/install/lib64:/gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/apps/viz/tools/gmp/gmp-5.1.3/install/lib:/gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/apps/viz/tools/mpfr/mpfr-3.1.2/install/lib:/gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/apps/viz/tools/mpc/mpc-1.0.2/install/lib:/gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch/apps/viz/tools/git/git-1.8.4.3/install/lib"
> export LD_RUN_PATH="/gpfs/bbp.cscs.ch//apps/viz/tools/gcc/gcc-4.9.0/install/lib64"
```

cc : @tgamblin @becker33
title: Use of --dirty with externals packages and compilers (always required?)
